rules: Rule1: Provided that the game is commercially successful, if it is not the case that the game has positive reviews or if having negative reviews implies that whenever the game is rushed, it is not well received, then the game has critical acclaim.
Rule2: Either the game has a publisher signed or the game is self published.
Rule3: If the game is self published, then whenever mismanagement of the game does not result in it being overbudget, the game is restructured.
Rule4: Under the condition that the game has a gold master, if the game has a publisher signed, then whenever mismanagement of the game does not lead to it being overbudget, the game is restructured.
Rule5: Either the game has post-launch support or, if development of the game is completed, then the game has a gold master.
Rule6: Provided that the game is marketed, the game is advertised.
Rule7: Whenever the game is marketed, the game is distributed.
Rule8: Given that the game is promoted, then under the condition that the game is advertised, the game is published.
Rule9: Either the game is promoted or the game is featured.
Rule10: Provided that the game is featured, whenever the game is advertised, the game is published.
Rule11: The project is funded or the project is backed.
Rule12: Whenever the project is backed, the game is developed.
Rule13: If the game is profitable, then the game is not successful.
Rule14: The game is profitable or the game is popular.
Rule15: Either the game is designed or the game is prototyped.
Rule16: If the game is prototyped, then the game is developed.
Rule17: Whenever the game is rushed, the game is well received.
Rule18: Under the condition that the game is scheduled, whenever the game is delayed, the game is not rushed.
Rule19: Either the game is failed or the game is developed.
Rule20: If the game is underfunded, then the game is not failed.
Rule21: The game is underfunded or the game is understaffed.
Rule22: Provided that the game is understaffed, the game is mismanaged.
Rule23: If the game is overbudget, then the game is not failed.
Rule24: Whenever the game is rebooted, the game is restructured.
Rule25: If the game is distributed, then the game is licensed.
Rule26: Under the condition that the publication is successful, the publication is profitable.
Rule27: Provided that the game is reviewed, if the game is not released, then the game is published.
Rule28: Provided that the game is buggy, the game is not playable.
Rule29: Whenever the game is critiqued, if the game is not released, then the game is published.
Rule30: Under the condition that the game is controversial, the game is banned.
Rule31: The game is censored or, provided that the game is controversial, the game is not banned.
Rule32: Provided that the game is patched, then the game is updated or the game is released.
Rule33: The game is patched or the game is fixed.
Rule34: Given that the game is developed, if the game is fixed, then the game is updated or the game is released.
Rule35: If the game is programmed, then the game is developed.
Rule36: Either the game is completed or the game is programmed.
Rule37: The game is unfinished or the game is not completed.
Rule38: Provided that the game is monetized, the game is pay-to-win.
Rule39: The game is monetized or, if it is not the case that funding the project does not lead to the game being developed, then the project is stalled, which implies the project is abandoned.
Rule40: If the game is free-to-play, then the game is not pay-to-win.
Rule41: The financial product is profitable or, provided that the game is monetized, the game is free-to-play.
Rule42: Whenever the financial product is successful, the financial product is not profitable.
Rule43: Either the financial product is successful or the financial product is viable.
Rule44: Provided that the financial product is viable, the financial product is not profitable.
Rule45: Either the game is crowdfunded or the game is kickstarted.
Rule46: Provided that the game is kickstarted, if funding the project does not lead to the game being developed, then the project is stalled.
Rule47: If the game is in early access, then whenever funding the project does not cause the game to be developed, the project is stalled.
Rule48: Provided that the studio is profitable, the studio is solvent.
Rule49: Either the studio is profitable or the studio is sustainable.
Rule50: Whenever the studio is sustainable, the studio is not bankrupt.
Rule51: Under the condition that the game is conceptualized, if the game is designed, then the game is developed.
Rule52: If the game is brainstormed, then the game is conceptualized.
Rule53: Provided that the game is planned, the game is conceptualized.
Rule54: Given that the game is QA approved, whenever the game is tested, if the game is buggy, then the game is playable.
Rule55: Either the game is QA approved or the game is beta tested.
Rule56: Under the condition that the game is pitched, if it is not the case that the game is documented or the game is brainstormed or the game is planned, then the game is archived.
Rule57: The game is pitched or the game is presented.

Rule58: The game is rejected or, under the condition that the game is greenlit, if the game is approved, then whenever the game is presented, provided that it is not the case that the game is documented or the game is brainstormed or the game is planned, the game is archived.
Rule59: Provided that the game has DLC released, the game has microtransactions.
Rule60: The game has DLC released or, if the game is not scheduled, then the game is rescheduled.
Rule61: Under the condition that the game has an expansion pack, the game does not have microtransactions.
Rule62: Either the game has downloadable content or the game has addon content.
Rule63: Whenever the game is beta tested, if the game is tested, then under the condition that the game is buggy, the game is playable.
Rule64: If the game has addon content, then provided that the game has DLC released, the game has an expansion pack.
Rule65: The game is moddable or, whenever the game has downloadable content, if the game has DLC released, then the game has an expansion pack.
Rule66: Provided that the game is open source, the game has modding tools.
Rule67: Either the game is open source or the game is proprietary.
Rule68: Whenever the game is proprietary, the game is not moddable.
Rule69: If the game has modding tools, then the game is not moddable.
Rule70: The game has early release or, if the game is not scheduled, then the game has postponed release.
Rule71: Either the game has a soft launch or the game does not have early release.
Rule72: The game has a full release or the game does not have a soft launch.
Rule73: Provided that the game is a critical success, the game does not have a full release.
Rule74: Either the game is a critical success or the game is a commercial success.
Rule75: Whenever the game is released, the game is developed.
Rule76: Under the condition that the game is a commercial success, the game is award winning.
Rule77: Provided that the game is award winning, the game is game of the year.
Rule78: If the game is game of the year, then the game does not have a full release.
Rule79: Given that the game is poorly received, whenever the game is rushed, the game is not well received.
Rule80: Either the game is poorly received or the game has negative reviews.
Rule81: Whenever the game has critical acclaim, the game has mixed reviews.
Rule82: If it is not the case that whenever development of the game has started, the game is not failed, then development of the game has failed.
Rule83: Whenever it is not the case that if the game is marketed, then the game is published, the publication is successful.
Rule84: If it is not true that provided that the game is marketed, the game is published, then the publication is not profitable.
Rule85: Provided that it is not the case that the game is polished or, whenever the game is designed, the game is developed, the game is rushed.
Rule86: If it is not true that if the game is popular, then the game is not successful, the game is buggy.
Rule87: Provided that it is not true that under the condition that the game is mismanaged, the game is overbudget, the game is rebooted.
Rule88: If it is not the case that whenever the game is mismanaged, the game is overbudget, then the game is not restructured.
Rule89: Under the condition that it is not true that if the game is licensed, then the game is published, the game is pirated.
Rule90: Provided that it is not the case that the game is reviewed or the game is critiqued, the game is controversial.
Rule91: If it is not the case that provided that the game is crowdfunded, the game is in early access, then the game is not refunded.
Rule92: If it is not the case that whenever the game is financially successful, the game is commercially successful, then the game is financially unsuccessful.
Rule93: Provided that it is not the case that if funding the project does not lead to the game being developed, then the project is stalled, the project is not abandoned.
Rule94: Whenever it is not true that if the game is not crowdfunded leading to early access, then the game is refunded, the studio is bankrupt.

Rule95: If it is not the case that provided that it is not true that if funding the project does not cause the game to be developed, then the project is stalled, the project is abandoned, then the project is cancelled.
Rule96: Provided that the game is not scheduled, the game is postponed.
Rule97: Under the condition that the game is not scheduled, the game is not postponed.
Rule98: Whenever the game is not released, the game is marketed.
Rule99: If the game is not released, then the game is not published.
Rule100: Under the condition that the game is not developed, the game is successful.
facts: Fact1: Development of the game has started.
Fact2: Development of the game is completed.
Fact3: The game is delayed.
Fact4: The game is tested.
Fact5: The game is approved.
Fact6: The game is greenlit.
Fact7: The game is financially successful.
Fact8: The game is not financially unsuccessful.
Fact9: Development of the game has not failed.
Fact10: The game does not have post-launch support.
Fact11: The project is not stalled.
Fact12: The project is not cancelled.
Fact13: The game is not polished.
Fact14: The game is not pirated.
Fact15: The game is not censored.
Fact16: The game is not updated.
Fact17: The game is not unfinished.
Fact18: The studio is not solvent.
Fact19: The game is not documented.
Fact20: The game is not archived.
Fact21: The game is not rejected.
Fact22: The game is not rescheduled.
Fact23: The game does not have postponed release.
Fact24: The game does not have positive reviews.
Fact25: The game does not have mixed reviews.
